Variable name: Gross domestic product. Average Adults. individuals
Intuitive description: Average Gross domestic product within a given percentile group. Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Methodological Notes: GDP level in 2016 from the UN SNA main tables. Until 1970, we use the GDP growth rates from Maddison (2007). Between 1971 and 2015, we use the GDP growth rates from the UN SNA main tables.  After 2016, we use the GDP growth rates from the IMF World Economic Outlook (forecast).
Sources: WID.world computations using: [URL][URL_LINK]http://unstats.un.org/unsd/snaama/Introduction.asp[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]United Nations National Accounts Main Aggregates Database[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://www.ggdc.net/maddison/other_books/Contours_World_Economy.pdf[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Maddison, Angus (2007). Contours of the World Economy 1-2030 AD.[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/weo/2018/01/weodata/index.aspx/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]IMF World Economic Outlook (04/2018)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Gross domestic product. Average Adults. individuals
Intuitive description: Average Gross domestic product within a given percentile group. Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Methodological Notes: GDP level in 2016 from the UN SNA main tables. Until 2015, we use the GDP growth rates from the UN SNA main tables.  After 2016, we use the GDP growth rates from the IMF World Economic Outlook (forecast).
Sources: WID.world computations using: [URL][URL_LINK]http://unstats.un.org/unsd/snaama/Introduction.asp[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]United Nations National Accounts Main Aggregates Database[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/weo/2018/01/weodata/index.aspx/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]IMF World Economic Outlook (04/2018)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Series updated by Luis Bauluz.[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Intuitive description: Average Gross domestic product within a given percentile group. Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

Methodological Notes: GDP level in 2016 from the UN SNA main tables. Until 1959, we use the GDP growth rates from Maddison (2007). Between 1960 and 1969, we use the GDP growth rates from the World Bank. Between 1970 and 2015, we use the GDP growth rates from the UN SNA main tables.  After 2016, we use the GDP growth rates from the IMF World Economic Outlook.

Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Methodological Notes: GDP level in 2016 from the UN SNA main tables. Until 1965, we use the GDP growth rates from Maddison (2007). Between 1966 and 1969, we use the GDP growth rates from the World Bank. Between 1970 and 2015, we use the GDP growth rates from the UN SNA main tables.  After 2016, we use the GDP growth rates from the IMF World Economic Outlook (forecast).
Sources: WID.world computations using: [URL][URL_LINK]http://data.worldbank.org/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]World Bank[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://unstats.un.org/unsd/snaama/Introduction.asp[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]United Nations National Accounts Main Aggregates Database[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://www.ggdc.net/maddison/other_books/Contours_World_Economy.pdf[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Maddison, Angus (2007). Contours of the World Economy 1-2030 AD.[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/weo/2018/01/weodata/index.aspx/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]IMF World Economic Outlook (04/2018)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Gross domestic product. Average Adults. individuals
Intuitive description: Average Gross domestic product within a given percentile group. Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Methodological Notes: Statistics cover all Korea (North and South combined) before liberation in 1945, and South Korea only after liberation. The National Accounts during 1941-1952 could not be estimated due to data limitation. However, the production index by industry except for 1944-1945 was estimated based on the available statistics on the production of major items. The series of real GDP before and after liberation can be connected by using the production index. The production index for 1940-53 is obtained from Kim, Nak Nyeon ed.(2012).
Sources: The production index for 1940-53 is obtained from Kim, Nak Nyeon ed.(2012), Hangugi changgi tonggye: kungmin kyejng, 1911-2010 [National Accounts of Korea, 1911-2010], Seoul: Seoul National University Press, Chapter 13, pp. 313-319.

Variable name: Gross domestic product. Average Adults. individuals
Intuitive description: Average Gross domestic product within a given percentile group. Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Methodological Notes: GDP level in 2016 from the UN SNA main tables. Until 1969, we use the GDP growth rates from Maddison (2007). Between 1970 and 2015, we use the GDP growth rates from the UN SNA main tables.  After 2016, we use the GDP growth rates from the World Bank Global Economic Monitor.
Sources: WID.world computations using: [URL][URL_LINK]http://econ.worldbank.org/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/EXTDEC/EXTDECPROSPECTS/0,,contentMDK:22855732~menuPK:6080253~pagePK:64165401~piPK:64165026~theSitePK:476883,00.html[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]World Bank[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://unstats.un.org/unsd/snaama/Introduction.asp[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]United Nations National Accounts Main Aggregates Database[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://www.ggdc.net/maddison/other_books/Contours_World_Economy.pdf[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Maddison, Angus (2007). Contours of the World Economy 1-2030 AD.[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Gross domestic product. Average Adults. individuals
Intuitive description: Average Gross domestic product within a given percentile group. Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Methodological Notes: GDP level in 2016 from the UN SNA main tables. Until 1959, we use the GDP growth rates from Maddison (2007). Between 1960 and 1969, we use the GDP growth rates from the World Bank. Between 1970 and 2015, we use the GDP growth rates from the UN SNA main tables.  After 2016, we use the GDP growth rates from the IMF World Economic Outlook (forecast).
Sources: WID.world computations using: [URL][URL_LINK]http://data.worldbank.org/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]World Bank[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://unstats.un.org/unsd/snaama/Introduction.asp[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]United Nations National Accounts Main Aggregates Database[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://www.ggdc.net/maddison/other_books/Contours_World_Economy.pdf[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Maddison, Angus (2007). Contours of the World Economy 1-2030 AD.[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; [URL][URL_LINK]http://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/weo/2018/01/weodata/index.aspx/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]IMF World Economic Outlook (04/2018)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Gross domestic product. Average Adults. individuals
Intuitive description: Average Gross domestic product within a given percentile group. Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Methodological Notes: GDP level in 2016 from the UN SNA main tables. Until 1989, we use the GDP growth rates from the World Bank. Between 1990 and 2015, we use the GDP growth rates from the UN SNA main tables.  After 2016, we use the GDP growth rates from the IMF World Economic Outlook.

Contours of the World Economy 1-2030 AD.[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Gross domestic product. Average Adults. individuals
Intuitive description: Average Gross domestic product within a given percentile group. Gross domestic product is the total value of goods and services produced by the national economy.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
